Posts.Content: Oct 7, 2015 10:20PM AmyA wrote: I'd just like to offer up my most heartfelt best wishes. Yes, I know what it's like to have a doctor walk into the room and say, "You've got cancer." To hear you're stage iv, I just can't imagine. I only know one woman, through my breast cancer support group who is stage iv. She's currently cancer-free. : ) Big hugs
Posts.Title: If you are not Stage IV but have questions, you may post here chrissyb Olma61

Posts.Content: Oct 7, 2015 09:25PM AmyA wrote: I can tell you that I had no nodes and that chemo was put on the table at me. As I was pre-menopausal, they said they recommend one round as insurance. I very luckily got my biopsy results back shortly thereafter and my numbers were good and chemo was taken off the table. So, perhaps your age is a factor? All the best
Posts.Title: Am I crazy? Kimmer33 Meow13
